lead_paragraph: Even those who praise Mr. Obama’s planned meeting on the refugee crisis wonder why the United States waited so long to mount a global response and why it has taken in so few Syrians.

byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington.

headline.print_headline: Obama’s Push for Refugee Aid Is Overdue, Critics Say
headline.main: Obama to Push Refugee Aid at U.N., but Critics Say Effort Is Overdue

snippet: Even those who praise Mr. Obama’s planned meeting on the refugee crisis wonder why the United States waited so long to mount a global response and why it has taken in so few Syrians....
abstract: Pres Obama plans to host meeting at United Nations to raise support for refugees around globe; critics, however, say response is overdue and express dissatisfaction with America's treatment of those fleeing violence in Central America.
